perturbation.original_text: e. "Net Revenue" shall mean gross receipts collected by Company or Reseller from the distribution of Company Products, [less third party commissions, equipment sales, delivery costs, taxes, refunds, and credits.
perturbation.changed_text: e. "Net Revenue" shall mean gross receipts collected by Company or Reseller from the distribution of Company Products.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the deductions from gross receipts, the definition of 'Net Revenue' becomes unclear, especially concerning what costs can be subtracted before commission calculations. This contradicts Exhibit B which bases reseller compensation on 'Net Revenue'. Without defined deductions, commission payments become ambiguously enforceable.

perturbation.original_text: 6. Compensation. In the event that Reseller (i) refers a Registered Referral to Company, through delivery to Company of the lead form attached hereto as Exhibit A, and (ii) such Registered Referral executes an agreement to purchase any of such Company Products or services, then Company shall pay Reseller a Referral Fee, as specified in Exhibit B attached hereto. Referral Fees will be paid within thirty (30) days of the collection of receivables from the Registered Referral. In the event an opportunity is requested and the government elects to use a different contract vehicle as described in 1g, reseller will still receive Referral Fee outlined in exhibit B.
perturbation.changed_text: 6. Compensation. In the event that Reseller (i) refers a Registered Referral to Company, through delivery to Company of the lead form attached hereto as Exhibit A, and (ii) such Registered Referral executes an agreement to purchase any of such Company Products or services, then Company may pay Reseller a Referral Fee. Referral Fees will be paid within thirty (30) days of the collection of receivables from the Registered Referral. In the event an opportunity is requested and the government elects to use a different contract vehicle as described in 1g, reseller will still receive Referral Fee.
perturbation.explanation: Changing "shall pay" to "may pay" creates ambiguity in the commitment to pay the referral fee. This contradicts the definition of Registered Referral and the intended purpose of the reseller agreement. Also, removing “outlined in exhibit B” contradicts the rest of the document which refers to the definitions in exhibit B.

perturbation.original_text: 12. Liability Limitation. EXCEPT FOR IN THE EVENT OF WILLFUL MISCONDUCT OR GROSS NEGLIGENCE, THE RESELLER AND ITS AFFILIATES SHALL NOT BE LIABLE TO THE COMPANY, AND SHALL HAVE NO OBLIGATION TO INDEMNIFY OR HOLD HARMLESS THE COMPANY, WITH RESPECT TO OR IN CONNECTION WITH ANY LOSS RESULTING FROM OR CAUSED BY THE COMPANY PRODUCTS.
perturbation.changed_text: 12. Liability Limitation. THE RESELLER AND ITS AFFILIATES SHALL NOT BE LIABLE TO THE COMPANY, AND SHALL HAVE NO OBLIGATION TO INDEMNIFY OR HOLD HARMLESS THE COMPANY, WITH RESPECT TO OR IN CONNECTION WITH ANY LOSS RESULTING FROM OR CAUSED BY THE COMPANY PRODUCTS.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the exception for willful misconduct or gross negligence, the reseller's liability limitation becomes absolute. This contradicts standard legal principles and could create uncertainty about whether the reseller is responsible for damages caused by their intentional or reckless actions related to the company products. This could conflict with Section 8 regarding Indemnification by the reseller.
